text: - The national security

sent his predecessor, Susan
Rice, a letter, General.

And in that letter,
he said she maintains
full, clear security clearance.

And of course, you
know, this comes

in the context of the things
the President has said.

All kinds of-- you know,
he's said derogatory things

about her and whether
she unmasked Trump

associates unfairly,
inappropriately,
and with political motivations.

You know, he said, she could
have committed a crime.

That's what the President of
the United States has said.

So how big of a deal
is it that Trump's

own national security
adviser would
basically take him on on this?

Saying her security
clearance is good.

JAMES CLAPPER: Well,
good on General McMaster,
who's a great soldier.

And he's doing exactly
the right thing here.

There's no-- there's
no criminal activity
connected with unmasking.

I did unmaskings during
my 6 and 1/2 years as DNI.
Susan did as well.

And it was not done for
political purposes whatsoever.
